com.reelyactive.blesdk.application

Class ReelyAwareApplicationCallback

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.reelyactive.blesdk.application.ReelyAwareApplicationCallback
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.app.Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks

    public class ReelyAwareApplicationCallback
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.app.Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks
    This class provides a convenient way to make your application aware of any Reelceivers.

    Register it using Application.registerActivityLifecycleCallbacks(Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks)

    Extend it to customize the behaviour of your application.

    The default behaviour is to bind to the BleService as soon as the app is created.

    See Also:
    Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks

    • Method Detail

      • onActivityResumed

        public void onActivityResumed(android.app.Activity activity)
        The default behaviour is to check if a ReelyAwareActivity is running, and call a scan if so.
        See startScan() and getScanType()
        Specified by:
        onActivityResumed in interface android.app.Application.ActivityLifecycleCallbacks
        Parameters:
        activity - The resumed Activity

      • onActivityPaused

        public void onActivityPaused(android.app.Activity activity)
        The default behaviour is to check if any ReelyAwareActivity is still running, and call a scan if so.
        See startScan() and getScanType()
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • getScanFilter

        protected ScanFilter getScanFilter()
        Override this in order to chose which scan filter is to be used before startScan() is called when the service starts.
        Returns:
        The ScanFilter to be used in the current application state.

      • getScanType

        protected BleService.ScanType getScanType()
        Override this in order to chose which kind of scan is to be used before startScan() is called when the service starts.
        Returns:
        The BleService.ScanType to be used in the current application state.

      • getActivityCount

        protected int getActivityCount()
        Get the number of ReelyAwareActivities currently running (0 or 1 basically)
        Returns:
        The number of ReelyAwareActivities running

      • onBleEvent

        protected void onBleEvent(BleService.Event event)
        This method is called when a BleService.Event is received.
        Its default behaviour is to notify the currently running ReelyAwareActivity (if any).
        Override this and you can customize the behaviour of the application.
        Parameters:
        event - The BleService.Event received from the BleService.

      • getContext

        protected android.content.Context getContext()
        Access the application Context.
        Returns:
        The application Context.

      • getCurrentActivity

        Get currently running Activity.
        Returns:
        The currently running Activity.

      • isReelyAware

        protected static boolean isReelyAware(android.app.Activity activity)
        Find out if an Activity implements ReelyAwareActivity
        Parameters:
        activity - The Activity
        Returns:
        true if the Activity implements ReelyAwareActivity, false if not.

      • onBleServiceBound

        protected void onBleServiceBound()
        This method is called when the is available.
        The default behaviour is to start a scan.
